channel.title: plotly on Digital Forays
channel.description: Recent content in plotly on Digital Forays

item.title: Total *non sequitur*: Tracking the Price of Silver
item.description: Silver Price Tracker So, my father has some vintage Silver pieces from 1973 and 1974 produced by the Franklin Mint with all kinds of different national banks on each one. We’ve been trying to figure out how to unload them—either to collectors or to folks that will simply melt them down for the silver alone. I figured I’d do a little coding. The first is a plot over the last couple of months of Silver prices:

item.title: Visualizing Online Class Discussion Boards (redux)
item.description: In a very early post on this blog, I went through some of my incredibly kludgy attempts to visualize the discussion boards in my ENGL200: Introduction to Literature: Weird Fiction course that I have been teaching every semester since Fall of 2019. I have improved things quite a bit and made the worfklow a whole lot easier. I figured I could, once again, take everyone through the steps to see if it might be at all helpful for others with similar use-cases.
